item.title: [DISTRELEC-3410] prod footer Italian shop - Missing option in Quick links
item.description:
Italian shop
Fax-Bestellung not in Quick links on IT shop.
This page is missing on IT shop
http://prod.distrelec.ch.distrelec.com/de/Fax-Bestellung/cms/fax-bestellung
See screen shots
item.summary: prod footer Italian shop - Missing option in Quick links

comments.comment: Ticket can be closed. No order by fax process in Italy.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3406] Wrong email on order confirmation page
item.description:
-make an order with b2e account
->on the order confirmation page at the end of the checkout process is the e-mail address from the account but it should be the one I entered during the checkout process
item.summary: Wrong email on order confirmation page

comments.comment: Update the order with the customer email before sending it to the front part.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3405] Favorit list for b2e is not greyed out
item.description:
-Login as distrelec.testing.b2e@gmail.com
-The icon for favorit list should become grey but it doesn't
item.summary: Favorit list for b2e is not greyed out

comments.comment: This behavior is correct. Please correct the test script. Only "Stücklisten Import" must be active.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3403] Mobile CC-Payment-Confirmation 404
item.description:
Das Abschicken des Formulars ist folgender Request:

POST /paygate/payinterim.aspx HTTP/1.1
Host: www.netkauf.de
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 2137
Cache-Control: no-cache
Pragma: no-cache
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,/;q=0.8
Origin: https://www.netkauf.de
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/33.0.1750.117 Safari/537.36
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Referer: https://www.netkauf.de/paygate/payssl.aspx?MerchantID=pg_50702t&template=distrelecmobile02&language=it
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate,sdch
Accept-Language: de-DE,de;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.6,en;q=0.4

Darauf hin erhält man folgende Antwort:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Cache-Control: no-cache
Pragma: no-cache
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Encoding: gzip
Expires: -1
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Server: Microsoft-IIS/7.5
Date: Fri, 28 Feb 2014 12:29:39 GMT
Connection: close
Content-Length: 1392

Im Anschlusst wird dann folgende URL aufgerufen:

https://www.netkauf.de/checkout/payment/failure?Len=299&

Richtig wäre in meinem Testfall jedoch der Aufruf von

https://m.test.distrelec.it/checkout/payment/failure?Len=299&

gewesen

Das deutet für mich darauf hin das entweder die Rücksprung URLs nicht richtig vom Hybris an Netkauf übergeben werden oder
ein Fehler bei Netkauf vorliegt.
Ich denke ersteres ist wahrscheinlicher. Namics sollte mit diesen Infos eigenltich die notwenigen Recherchen anstellen können.
Man sieht das auch am Inhalt der payinterim.aspx:

<html>
<head>
<META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" Content="Microsoft Visual Studio 6.0">
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="REFRESH" Content="3; URL=/checkout/payment/failure?Len=299&">
<title>PayInterim</title>
</head>
...

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3402] no order confirmation mail
item.description:
Made an order with b2e customer used email address distrele.testing+klammheimlich@gmail.com
but no confirmation mail was sent

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3401] Oder confirmarion PDF corrupt
item.description: The PDF attached to the eMail order confirmation is corrupt.

comments.comment: Was an error in the XSL template

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3398] Missing information in confirmation email
item.description: In the confirmation email the shop address is missing and the opening hours. see print screen

comments.comment: Backend, check values in file email-orderConfirmationBody.vm on line 91.

There was a mismatch between some attributes in the template and the related data object attributes.

Issue fixed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3397] Must be removed from the webpage (shop opening information)
item.description: The opening hours are only from Mo.-Fr. 07:30 - 18:00. -> Sa. 08:00 - 12.00 must be removed as the shop is closed on a Saturday. See print screen
item.summary: Must be removed from the webpage (shop opening information)

comments.comment:
Done.
We display the opening hours from Saturday only if an opening time is set (Warehouse object in hybris)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3396] e-mail to friend will not sent
item.description:
OS: Windows 7 Enterprise
Browser: IE 8.0.7601.16385
URL: http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Aktive-Bauelemente/Analoge-Schaltungen/c/cat-L2-3D_525338?filter_Preis=3216+-+3637&sort=ProductNumberMovex:desc

Go to url above, click on the share icon, e-mail, fill out the form, click on ok, message tell us e-mail was sent, but no e-mail will be received. (img_466/467_pzu)
item.summary: e-mail to friend will not sent

comments.comment: Not reproducible

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3392] Price range doesn't work
item.description:
OS: Windows 7 Enterprise
Browser: IE 8.0.7601.16385
URL: http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Aktive-Bauelemente/Analoge-Schaltungen/c/cat-L2-3D_525338?filter_Preis=3216+-+3637

Go to category level 3, select a price range, price range doesn't work. (img_465_pzu)

comments.comment:
Issue fixed.

I had to update how the price group code is retrieved.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3390] Confirmation Email wrong display
item.description:
When I open the confirmation email there are wrong displays in the email. Kindly see print screens.
Printscreen 6 the Reference text "start toto" is squeezed in. I suggest we put the reference text "see toto" after the article number

comments.comment: Backend, please check Availability Prop
The second Screenshot should be resolved when the Availability String is properly filled.

* Image: Most likely, the image was not shown because of the Basic Authentication of the TEST-System. Tests from my side were successful.
* Availability: Fixed.
* Position of Art. Nr. and Ref: See comment from Dominic above.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3388] Wrong ensighten tag
item.description:
The SEO team gave us the wrong secification of the ensighten tag:

Instead of:
Distrelec AT
<script src="//nexus.ensighten.com/distrelecAT/Bootstrap.js"></script>

Distrelec CH
<script src="//nexus.ensighten.com/distrelecCH/Bootstrap.js"></script>

Distrelec IT
<script src="//nexus.ensighten.com/distrelecIT/Bootstrap.js"></script>

it should be:

Distrelec AT
<script src="//nexus.ensighten.com/distrelec/distrelecAT/Bootstrap.js"></script>

Distrelec CH
<script src="//nexus.ensighten.com/distrelec/distrelecCH/Bootstrap.js"></script>

Distrelec IT
<script src="//nexus.ensighten.com/distrelec/distrelecIT/Bootstrap.js"></script>

comments.comment: added /distrelec

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3374] Data modification HMC
item.description:
I did the following modifications on the rebate models in the HMC:

Italy Models:

ENEL10: 10% CAT / 5 % DAT
EON: 15% CAT
RAIWAY: 10% CAT/6%DAT
SCONTO05: 5% CAT
SCONTO13: 3 % CAT /3 % DAT
SCONTO15: 5% CAT /5% DAT
SCONTO5D: 5 % DAT
SCONTO53: 5% CAT/ 3 % DAT
SCONTO6C: 6 % CAT
SCONTO63: 6% CAT /3 % DAT
SCONTO75: 7% CAT / 5 % DAT
SCONTO8C: 8 % CAT
SCONTO85: 8% CAT/ 5% DAT
SCONTO87: 15% CAT/5% DAT
SCONT10C: 10% CAT

Modification on Italy taxes:
from 21% to 22%

Modification on Italy credit card uplift:
Could you please change the uplift from 2.5% to "no uplift"

comments.comment:
I deleted all the existing rebate models and shipping/payment conditions prior to a new impex import.
(have missed to change one percentage for Italy in the impex file. Will follow in v1.1.2 in impex. Manually fixed in hMC)

Please test - especially credit card cost for IT (0%).

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3373] FF Campaign link issue
item.description:
• Search for: http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=fluke
  • Click on a item box of "Unsere Empfehlung für Sie" e.g. http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Apple-iPhone-5C-pink-16-GB-Apple-ME503FD-A/p/11073060&origPos=18
  • 404 Error appears: I think the problem is the position parameter from Fact Finder: "&origPos=18".

comments.comment:
No idea, what this parameter is used for :-)
But the URL is not correct. The parameter origPos should be added after a "?" instead of a "&".
Issue fixed. Product URL creation has been updated.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3343] Facets displayed for each unit
item.description:
Facets are now split by units within one unit group, that's not usable.

Please roll it back.

comments.comment: I asked Mr. Türk (see my mail), if we can grouping the facets which have the same unit group. If yes "Kapaziät" will be grouped but "Nennspannung" not, because VDC and VAC are different unit groups and I think that makes sens, if this facets are separated. Are you with me?

The issue here is, that the unit definitions are missing in the FF export and in that case, FF does not know how to calculate from one unit to an other one.
Cornel is currently analysing why this units are missing in the export. I'll give you an update as soon as possible.

Finding: The issue is the same as we had a few weeks ago. The definition of the attribute "Kapazität" is not proper. What does that mean?
The attribute "Kapaziät" is used in different cases, ones for HDs and here for "Kondensatoren". But the units in this cases are completely different. But the same attribute definition is use. As this attribute definition has just one default unit, we miss the other one during the units export for FF, as we don't know, that the attribute has an other case were it is used with an other unit definition.

Solutions:
S1: The PIM team creates for all this cases, I think "Kapazität" is not a single case, a second or additional attributes, that are named equal but have a different attribute id. As the cases, the attributes are used are completely different, I think we have also to split up the attribute definition. And of course they have different default units.

S2: We change the export query. We do not create the export of the units based on the attributes definition. We use the product features. That is not really a solution as the export will lose a lot in performance and the number of product features will grow and grow, and in that case the performance will become worse and more worse.

I asked Florian to look at together with Patrick Zubler if we can change all the affected attributes in PIM.
@Florian: What is the outcome? Is it possible?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3321] Rebate models modification
item.description:
As discussed we need a modification on the rebate models:
At the moment we only can define one percentage rate per catalog on a model.

--> Rebate model A --> 5% on CAT items

We need an additional modification to achieve the needs of Italy.
The following definitions should be possible:

--> Rebate model A --> 5% on CAT items and 3% on DAT items
--> Rebate model B --> 6% on CAT
--> Rebate model C --> 2% on DAT

comments.comment:
As mentioned at the phone...
In case of any question, please ask Florian or me.
@Florian: This change is included in the next deployment. Please test it carefully, but I think there should be no issues.
Tested!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3317] Prepare Apache config for go-live of CH/IT
item.summary: Prepare Apache config for go-live of CH/IT
